required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The NEOPRENE project proposes to examine processes that are among the earliest precursors of cognitive functions and assess 1) the relationship between neonatal cognitive precursors and cortical structure, structural connectivity and functional connectivity at birth and 2) the relationship between neonatal cognitive precursors and neurodevelopment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Longitudinal study with measures at birth and at age 2.

primary_outcome.description: Electrical field potential changes in the parietal and frontal cortices

primary_outcome.measure: Near infrared spectroscopy evoked response amplitude
primary_outcome.description: Oxygenated hemoglobin concentration changes in the somatosensory cortex

primary_outcome.measure: Grey matter volume in the somatosensory cortex
primary_outcome.description: Thickness measured on T2 images in magnetic resonance imaging
Tractography using Diffusion tensor Imaging in magnetic resonance imaging
Synchronization at rest using blood-oxygen level dependent signal in magnetic resonance imaging
Qualitative composite assessment using clinical interview, routine pediatric screening and questionnaires (full sensory profile, preschooler Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function)

arm_group.description: All participants undergo the same measurements (longitudinal design)

intervention.description: Brain activity will be measured using 128-channel EEG and 2 channel NIRS during tactile stimulation (15 minutes sequence of vibrations) while the newborn is asleep.
Structural (T1-T2), siffusion tensor imaging and blood-oxygen level dependant signal will be acquired in a subset of 40 subjects (20 minutes while asleep)

Cognitive evaluation at age 2 (Parental questionnaires on sensory profiles, executive functions and neurodevelopmental disorders screening, child tests : movement assessment battery, Laby, Head-toes-shoulders-knees)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm newborn (born < 34 weeks + 6days)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Brain injury
- Respiratory assistance on measurement day
- Infection on measurement day
- Sedation on measurement day
- Parents < 18 years old or unable to give informed consent
